page.title: 07THE A120
page.content: The A120 is one of the busiest roads in Essex. It stretches from Puckeridge to the outskirts of Colchester and it cuts Takeley into two pieces. It is very dangerous and there is only one safe place to cross. This is at the traffic lights but even there the lights are green for only 30 seconds. Elderly people and mums with young children are frightened to cross the road. The pavement is so narrow in places that the suction from heavy lorries could affect your balance and on wet days the spray soaks pedestrians. Noise is another problem for those who live near the A120. Accidents happen frequently, causing long tailbacks; these accidents often occur because people exceed the 40 mph speed limit. This is how we see the A120 but with the expansion of Stansted Airport, its use may change.
